Wisdom *__04.1: O how beautiful is the chaste generation with glory: for the memory thereof is immortal: because it is known both with God and with men.
Wisdom *__04.2: When it is present, they imitate it: and they desire it when it hath withdrawn itself, and it triumpheth crowned for ever, winning the reward of undefiled conflicts.
Wisdom *__04.3: But the multiplied brood of the wicked shall not thrive, and bastard slips shall not take deep root, nor any fast foundation.
Wisdom *__04.4: And if they flourish in branches for a time, yet standing not fast, they shall be shaken with the wind, and through the force of winds they shall be rooted out.
Wisdom *__04.5: For the branches not being perfect, shall be broken, and their fruits shall be unprofitable, and sour to eat, and fit for nothing.
Wisdom *__04.6: For the children that are born of unlawful beds, are witnesses of wickedness against their parents in their trial.
Wisdom *__04.7: But the just man, if he be prevented with death, shall be in rest.
Wisdom *__04.8: For venerable old age is not that of long time, nor counted by the number of years: but the understanding of a man is grey hairs.
Wisdom *__04.9: And a spotless life is old age.
Wisdom *__04.10: He pleased God and was beloved, and living among sinners he was translated.
Wisdom *__04.11: He was taken away lest wickedness should alter his understanding, or deceit beguile his soul.
Wisdom *__04.12: For the bewitching of vanity obscureth good things, and the wandering of concupiscence overturneth the innocent mind.
Wisdom *__04.13: Being made perfect in a short space, he fulfilled a long time:
Wisdom *__04.14: For his soul pleased God: therefore he hastened to bring him out of the midst of iniquities: but the people see this, and understand not, nor lay up such things in their hearts:
Wisdom *__04.15: That the grace of God, and his mercy is with his saints, and that he hath respect to his chosen.
Wisdom *__04.16: But the just that is dead, condemneth the wicked that are living, and youth soon ended, the long life of the unjust.
Wisdom *__04.17: For they shall see the end of the wise man, and shall not understand what God hath designed for him, and why the Lord hath set him in safety.
Wisdom *__04.18: They shall see him, and shall despise him: but the Lord shall laugh them to scorn.
Wisdom *__04.19: And they shall fall after this without honour, and be a reproach among the dead for ever: for he shall burst them puffed up and speechless, and shall shake them from the foundations, and they shall be utterly laid waste: they shall be in sorrow, and their memory shall perish.
Wisdom *__04.20: They shall come with fear at the thought of their sins, and their iniquities shall stand against them to convict them.
